passage_text: : of or relating to races or large groups of people who have the same customs, religion, origin, etc. : associated with or belonging to a particular race or group of people who have a culture that is different from the main culture of a country.

adjective. noun. The definition of ethnic is someone or something associated with a particular subgroup that has a shared national original, cultural identity or race. An example of ethnic is Mexican food. An ethnic is defined as a person who is a member of a specific racial or cultural group that is considered a minority.

The traditional definition of race and ethnicity is related to biological and sociological factors respectively. Race refers to a person's physical characteristics, such as bone structure and skin, hair, or eye color.

Ethnicity is the ethnic group or groups that people identify with or feel they belong to. Ethnicity is a measure of cultural affiliation, as opposed to race, ancestry, nationality or citizenship. Ethnicity is self perceived and people can belong to more than one ethnic group.
People derived from of a variety of ethnic origin types currently inhabit the United States, and which include white, black, American Indian, Asian, Pacific Islander and Eskimo.

noun. The definition of ethnic is someone or something associated with a particular subgroup that has a shared national original, cultural identity or race. An example of ethnic is Mexican food. An ethnic is defined as a person who is a member of a specific racial or cultural group that is considered a minority.

The ethnic origin of the individual is irrelevant outside of how their government would proceed to interact with our business. 4 people found this helpful. We strive to have diversity in the workplace and hire without regard to religion, sex, and ethnic origin to ensure that we hire the best workers.
